info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 20 at 8:35PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia...
Nottoway River At Sebrell affecting Sussex and Southampton Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...
Blackwater River Above Franklin affecting City of Suffolk, Southampton, City of Franklin and Isle of Wight Counties.
Blackwater River above Zuni affecting Southampton and Isle of Wight Counties.
Blackwater River near Dendron affecting Surry County.
For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Franklin at US Highway 58/258, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Blackwater River near Dendron.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 36.3 feet, Walls Bridge Road begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 36.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 35.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM EDT Thursday was 37.2 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 36.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 36.4 feet on 01/21/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 900 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
